title: Carrie Underwood talks stressful first flight for 'American Idol,' says flying 'freaks' her out
text:
CLOSE

Carrie Underwood performs on "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" on Oct. 3, 2019. (Photo: Scott Kowalchyk/CBS)

Jesus, take the wheel! Carrie Underwood revealed that her first time on a plane didn't leave her feeling "Blown Away."

The singer appeared on Thursday's "Late Show" in a dusty rose ensemble dripping with bling, which Stephen Colbert compared to "tentacles of glitter" as if his guest had "been attacked by a very glamorous jelly fish."

During their chat, Underwood revealed that shortly after getting the green light to head to Hollywood for "American Idol," she set off on a plane solo.

The Season 4 winner of the singing competition described her first ride as "terrifying" and shared she isn't exactly at ease in the skies even today.

"Yeah, I mean it still freaks me out, to be honest," she said. "I'm 36-years-old, and I've been to lots of airports, but... back then I was by myself and there were lots of connecting flights to get there."

Underwood recalled she "made a couple connections," but that "one plane was late so I missed the next plane..."

"I was like, 'I'm gonna have to find some nice airport employee to tell me what to do, 'cause I don't know what to do," she said of her predicament. "I'm on the phone with whoever our contact person was and I'm like, 'Please don't kick me off the show.'

"But I made it!" she added.

Underwood tried out for the show formerly on Fox and now on ABC, 15 years ago.

She told Colbert she was unsure about what would happen after her audition.

"I don't really know what I thought was gonna come of it. It was just kind of like, I saw the auditions on the news happening in other towns so I thought, 'Why not?' " she said. "Worked out all right."

In our very best Matthew McConaughey impression we would say it worked out all right, all right, all right!
